title: (x) Phyllis Road unusual serif italic - Cochin {Eric Gordon}
content:
Good morning all... I need a little assistance identifying this serif italic. It has a very unique ’h’ and ’d’

Any thoughts?

Big thanks to everyone.  
ck

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [PhyllisFont.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081209044958/http:/typophile.com/files/PhyllisFont.jpg) | 25.21 KB |

 [‹ "Kamel Chenaouy" guitar logo, 25 years old](http://web.archive.org/web/20081209044958/http:/typophile.com/node/36873 "Go to previous forum topic") [Western-style ornate caps "White Bear" ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081209044958/http:/typophile.com/node/36870 "Go to next forum topic")
author: yaazmeena

comments.content: Cochin Italic. Not sure if it’s [URW’s](http://web.archive.org/web/20081209044958/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/cochin/) or [Linotype’s](http://web.archive.org/web/20081209044958/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/cochin/), of if there’s much difference...
Eric - Thank you much! So sad - I should have known that. Time to brush up on my type id skills.
